result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald S. Noah Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Charli
Case Called: 11:55 a.m.
INCLUDES: 15CF859, 15CM1998, 16CM146

State appears by ADA Chad Minder.  Def appears in person with Atty Eric Eickhoff.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
15CF859
Ct. 1- (False Imprisonment- Repeater-DA)>> DISMISS
Ct. 2- (Battery- Repeater-DA)>> DRI
Ct. 4- Criminal Trespass to Dwelling- Repeater-DA)>> DRI
Ct. 5- (Battery- Repeater-DA)>> DRI
16CM146
Ct. 1- (DC-Repeater)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA:
15CF859
Ct. 3- (DC- Repeater-DA)>> NO CONTEST
Ct. 6- (DC- Repeater-DA)>> NO CONTEST
15CM1998
Ct. 1- (Resisting Officer- Repeater)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 2 years prison (1 year IC, 1 year ES), both cases to run concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; CC; 2 DA Surcharges; DNA Sample and Surcharge.

COURT Orders 301 days credit on each.

Adj: 12:06 p.m.

records.addlTxt: No contact with co-defendant A.V. Clerk Marisa.

Deft's requests COURT recuse in these files. 
COURT will NOT recuse but notes deft may file for substitution. 

ARRAIGNMENT IN 15CF859. 
Information previously filed. Reading Waived.

Deft files for substitution. 

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 16CM146. 
Reading waived.
